title: Kriegspiel: the War-Game. [A novel.]
author: Groome, Francis Hindes
snippet: Now it would be a salmon,or a box of cigars, or a brace of grouse, a hare, or acouple of chickens; and on the morrow, perhaps, a bigorder of groceries, and three or four gorgeously-boundbooks (on remarkable subjects -1), or a fur-lined overcoat,or a gold scarf-pin, and so forth. They were alwaysdirected to " Mr. Leonard Keith, care of A. Wallace, 80East Mayfield; " and at first Lionel always returnedthem to the shops from which they had been sent—nodoubt to the contentment of the shopkeepers. Sagulmust have discovered this, for presently they arrivedwith no indication of their source; and then it wasdifficult to know what to do with them, with such atleast as were perishable.
